messages.message: webapp is up and logs are pretty much empty. Now, the ppy-server-nginx link isn't working either. All services are up
server-nginx is also up and no error logs
I'm gonna resync with dev and see
i guess if the tunneling isn’t working, it makes sense that you don’t see any logs since no requests are getting to server-nginx?
Yes, but the ppy-server-nginx was working and then it suddenly stopped

@sean.donohoe could you please help take a look?

i've tried restarting, updating: https://instabase.sandboxes.site/sandboxes/sayd-dev
the redis removal caused the ppy-server-nginx issue resolved. but the tunnel is still broken

yeah I see your nginx up and running fine -- based on this I suspect there's an issue with two different processes listening on ipv4 and ipv6
```➜  instabase git:(fix-classification-with-org) ✗ sudo netstat -ltpn | grep ':80'
tcp        0      0 127.0.0.1:8080          0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN      1/uinit             
tcp        0      0 0.0.0.0:80              0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN      3058/docker-proxy   
tcp6       0      0 :::80                   :::*                    LISTEN      3065/docker-proxy   
tcp6       0      0 :::8081                 :::*                    LISTEN      3618/webpack```
nvm got the same response with `curl -vvv http://127.0.0.1/` and `curl -vvv http://\[::1\]/ `
oops, did you change anything right now? It just loaded
I did not -- fwiw you also do not need port forwarding if you are accessing via the `ppy` endpoint on your sandbox!

ah right - @Sayd is there a specific reason you need to use port forwarding since i assume you’re running all services on crafting and you’re accessing the sandbox via https://ppy-server-nginx--sayd-dev-instabase.instabase.site.sandboxes.run/?
Nope, well one of them was google oauth wasn't working because that link wasn't present in redirect uri but that's fixed. The issue was even the ppy-link wasn't working but now they both do
